translations: （买进和卖出股票时）遭受双重损失的
<美>（用粗木锯）锯；<非正式>面临双重不利情况；<非正式>强迫做；<非正式>（买进和卖出股票时）遭受双重损失（whipsaw 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.sentence: Across the Atlantic shares in American Banks whipsawed on worries about a Greek default and rumours of policy breakthroughs.
sentences.translation: 大西洋彼岸的美国银行里所持有股份也在对希腊违约的担忧以及政策的突破性进展的传闻里震荡。

sentences.sentence: Trend-followers can get “whipsawed” in volatile markets, buying at the top of a short-term trend and then selling at a loss shortly afterwards.
sentences.translation: 在易变化的市场中，趋势投资者可能遭市场洗盘，在一个短期升势的顶部买入，不久之后被迫割肉卖出。

sentences.sentence: Trend-followers can get "whipsawed" in volatile markets, buying at the top of a short-term trend and then selling at a loss shortly afterwards.
sentences.translation: 在动荡的市场中，趋势追随者可能受到“双重打击“，在短期势头最强劲的时候买进，随后很快又亏本卖出。
